revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins and Rifting: Insights from Deep Drilling Results
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of passive continental margins and the rifting process, using deep drilling results and onshore surveys. The authors argue against the idea that sea floor spreading and plate tectonics alone can explain the structural evolution of a region. They present evidence from the Atlas Mountains of Morocco and the eastern North American and northwest African continental margins, emphasizing the importance of considering the whole geological environment and history.
